image.altText: An overhead view of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre.

props.synopsis: Australia’s biggest lake is believed to have reached capacity on only three occasions in the past 160 years, but the mass of floodwater now flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is raising more than river levels.

title.children: 'Absolutely beautiful': Waters flowing into Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre a sight to behold

image.altText: A pacific gull stands on a beach as water comes around its legs.

props.synopsis: Concerns are growing for SA's endangered sea lions, prompting a call for a Coorong-based testing laboratory to ensure a "nimble" response to H5N1 bird flu's potential arrival.

title.children: Race to protect Australia's vulnerable wildlife from H5N1 bird flu

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis:
A young child has died at the scene after they were hit by a station wagon in Adelaide's northern suburbs. 

Major Crash Investigators are looking into the cause of the accident.

title.children: Young child dies after being hit by car in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A sign reading Port Augusta Prison Smoke Free Environmen outside a car park and brown building

props.synopsis:
A man accused of the murder of his wife and attempted murder of his daughter has died in the Port Augusta Prison.

The death is not suspicious and will be the subject of a coronial investigation.

title.children: Accused murderer dies in prison before scheduled court appearance

image.altText: A road closed sign in front of a street

props.synopsis: South Australian police allege a man who became unresponsive while being arrested on Thursday morning “violently resisted” police.

title.children: SA Police make new claims about arrest in Royston Park

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: A charge of using a Nazi symbol has been dropped against National Socialist Network leader Thomas Sewell.

title.children: Charges dropped for Nazi symbol use at Australia Day gathering

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man in a dark suit poses for a corporate-style headshot.

props.synopsis: A South Australian councillor says he will appeal to the ombudsman after colleagues called on him to quit his position for refusing to acknowledge Welcome to Country ceremonies.

title.children: Councillor refuses to resign after Welcome to Country snub

image.altText: Puffer fish Kangaroo Island

props.synopsis: Storms earlier this week could have broken up an algal bloom that has led to a huge number of marine wildlife deaths off South Australia.

title.children: Falling ocean temperatures off SA coast bring hope for end of toxic algal bloom

image.altText: Jack Ball, a 39-year-old trans man in glasses, smiles brightly in front of a photographic work, including pops of orange colour.

props.synopsis: Artist Jack Ball found transphobia, desire and care in 1950s and 70s newspapers. They turned them into the installation Heavy Grit, which just won the Ramsay Art Prize.

title.children: 'Restless, kinetic' artwork mixing photography and sculpture wins $100k

image.altText: A road train drives down a road underneath orange street lights. Shops line the street.

props.synopsis: As the SA government prepares to hand down its last budget before a state election, it recognises a need to build a bypass to take trucks off Adelaide roads — but how much is it willing to spend?

title.children: Long-awaited Adelaide freight bypass hits crossroad in funding tussle

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A coroner has called for SA Police to change its operating practices after a "high need detainee requiring medical attention" deteriorated while he was left alone in his cell for 41 minutes, after officers decided he needed an ambulance.

title.children: Detainee left alone in cell suffers cardiac arrest waiting for ambulance

image.altText: Emergency vehicles near the wreckage of a truck and other destroyed vehicles on a stretch of highway in the countryside.

props.synopsis: A multi-vehicle crash on the Western Highway in Victoria has been described by police as "absolute carnage".

title.children: Two Victorians, SA man identified as victims of highway crash

image.altText: A dry paddock in south west victoria

props.synopsis: Drought-stricken parts of southern Australia, including Melbourne and Adelaide, are bracing for an increased spike in bushfire risk this winter, according to a new report.

title.children: Dried-out southern regions face increased winter fire risk

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: A proposal to build a Tesla factory in Adelaide's south is one step closer, despite 95 per cent of respondents to the local council's public consultation opposing the plan.

title.children: Council progresses plan for Tesla battery factory, despite 'anti-Elon' sentiment

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A manslaughter charge has been dropped against a South Australian woman over the death of her six-year-old daughter. Instead, she has pleaded guilty to three charges of criminal neglect. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died.

title.children: SA mother pleads guilty to criminal neglect over death of 6yo daughter

image.altText: Identical twins Danny and Michael Philippou pose for a photo, making funny faces in front of a neutral background.

props.synopsis: Aussie directors Danny and Michael Philippou are behind the $143 million smash-hit Talk to Me, but they won't be switching Adelaide for Hollywood. Now they're back with a gory new feature, once again exploring the horrors of teen life in suburbia.

title.children: Why Aussie directors behind $143m smash-hit won't be moving to Hollywood

image.altText: A man surrounded by emergency service workers holding a blanket and plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued a man from the bottom of a deep cave in the centre of a regional South Australian city.

title.children: Man pulled to safety after getting stuck in 30m deep sinkhole

image.altText: Kahli Johnson celebrates her goal for the Matildas on debut.

props.synopsis: Missing the likes of Sam Kerr and Mary Fowler, an inexperienced Matildas line-up defeat Argentina 2-0 in the first of their two friendlies.

title.children: Matildas debutant scores in classy win over Argentina in opening friendly

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson admits lying to police about key details after a deadly lunch, but her defence claims panic — not malice — drove her actions, arguing there's no proof she intended to kill.

title.children: Erin Patterson lied about mushroom foraging but her lawyers argue she's no killer

image.altText: A young boy sits on a mattress on a cement floor, holding up his prosthetic leg.

props.synopsis: Palestinian children evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment have started being sent back to Gaza, with Israeli forces confiscating their belongings on the way back into the strip.

title.children: Evacuated during ceasefire, children are being sent back to Gaza

image.altText: A woman poses for a photo while wearing a headscarf

props.synopsis: Long a no-go zone for travellers, the relative stability provided by the Taliban's return to power in Afghanistan has also meant the return of tourism.

title.children: Are travel influencers whitewashing the Taliban?

image.altText: A woman wearing a white blouse stands outdoors with trees and grass visible in the background.

props.synopsis: Sarah Waters tried for years to quit smoking, but with cigarettes for sale everywhere, the temptation was hard to deny.

title.children: Ex-smoker backs push to ban tobacco sales at supermarkets

image.altText: Composite image showing the Westfield logo, Joel Cauchi, a digital clock, a wreath with "Rest in Peace" and Amy Scott.

props.synopsis: The five-week coronial inquest into the stabbing at Bondi Junction painted a complete picture of what happened during the attack that stopped Sydney.

title.children: How the Bondi Junction Westfield stabbing attack unfolded

image.altText: Donald Trump points.

props.synopsis: The president's claim comes hours after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent stated that trade talks with China were "a bit stalled".

title.children: Trump says China 'totally violated' tariff pact with US

image.altText: An eye with a blue background

props.synopsis: Russia has changed how it deployed its spy operations "to prepare for destabilisation" in Europe and react to the "counterintelligence regime" from Ukraine's allies.

title.children: A 'reckless campaign of Russian sabotage' has been uncovered. What does it mean?

image.altText: An illustration depicting two women sitting with their backs to us, in bathing suits. One is fat, the other slim.

props.synopsis: "Body-positive" content can be found all over social media. Activists say it's missing the point.

title.children: How body positivity was co-opted by brands and influencers

image.altText: A brick building with a bright, colourful mural depicting tropical plants and birds, a frog, and the word LIBRARY above a window

props.synopsis: Offering millions of books, free internet access and everything from craft clubs to storytelling dogs, libraries are an essential public space — particularly in regional and remote Australia.

title.children: How libraries are 'the glitter glue' binding communities together

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: Labor promised to slash student debts if it won the federal election. We've answered your questions on what you need to do to have your outstanding debt reduced.

title.children: The government promised to cut my HECS debt. When will I get it?

image.altText: Katie in a white wedding gown reading vows off flash cards with Tim facing her in a suit on Married At First Sight

props.synopsis: The Black Dog Institute says gaslighting is a form of psychological manipulation that causes someone to doubt their perceptions. It's something that shows up a lot in popular culture, which gave us the word. But a US expert warns that while pop culture has given much-needed visibility to gaslighting, the word is often used too casually and at times incorrectly.

title.children: From MAFS to TikTok psychologists, gaslighting has become a buzzword

image.altText: A woman in a high visibility jacket, in front of a community group.

props.synopsis: Flood-affected NSW communities have banded together to set up recovery centres, deliver meals and offer a hand to their neighbours.

title.children: Flooded residents 'running on empty' as they take on recovery

image.altText: A young woman with dark hair wearing a black suit, sitting outdoors in a city street with the sun shining behind her

props.synopsis: A revealing memoir from one of Australia's most beloved authors and an exciting debut about a literary fraudster in the tradition of Helen Demidenko are among this month's best new releases.

title.children: The six books our critics couldn't put down in May

image.altText: Two men stand together in front of a herd of dairy cows on a farm, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian dairy farmers trial microbes across 500 hectares of land with the help of a "top-notch" soil biologist to reduce their reliance on synthetic fertilisers such as urea.

title.children: Farmers trial soil microbes to cut synthetic fertiliser use

image.altText: Aivi Luik holds up her hands in a heart shape

props.synopsis: Women are claiming space in the sporting landscape, but when it comes to marketing, does their competitiveness go missing?

title.children: Is the marketing of women's sport falling short?

image.altText: A man dressing black with a pair of sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Brand, once one of Britain's most high-profile broadcasters and US singer Katy Perry's ex-husband, appeared at Southwark Crown Court and denied all five criminal charges on Friday.

title.children: Russell Brand pleads not guilty to rape and sex assault charges

image.altText: A court sketch of a man in a suit with officers on either side

props.synopsis: Paul Doyle, from the West Derby area of Liverpool, is charged with seven offences including dangerous driving and two counts of causing grievous bodily harm with intent.

title.children: UK man Paul Doyle, 53, appears in court over Liverpool parade crash
